TEXT.TITLE: Mount Albert Edward, Papua New Guinea

SENTENCE.STRING: is a 3,990 metre high mountain in the Wharton Range in Central Province, Papua New Guinea.
consists of two peaks about 400 metres apart, a cross marks the top of the slightly higher western peak and a trig station marks the eastern peak.
lies approximately 140km north of Port Moresby.
The first recorded ascent was in 1906 by C A W Monckton.
There were further ascents in the early 20th century, but the first detailed account was made in 1935 following an ascent by Richard Archbold and Austin L. Rand in 1933.
